Manx: O vraar t’ou scarrit voym son traa
English: O brother you are separated from me for a time

Manx: Ny smoo cha gluinym dty choraa
English: No more will I hear your voice

Manx: Choud’s ta mee bio ’syn eill
English: Whilst I am living in the flesh

Manx: Gys aagyms neesht yn thie dy chray
English: Until I leave again the house of clay

Manx: As roshtyn gys yn voayl dy fea
English: And arrive at the place of rest

Manx: Yn boayl neem oo meeiteil
English: The place (where) I will meet you

Manx: Cre’n caghlaa mooar ta ayns dty stayd
English: What great change is in your state

Manx: Kionfenish Yee ta’n cronney ayd
English: In God’s presence the portion is yours

Manx: Marish ny flaunyssee
English: With the dwellers of heaven

Manx: T’ou rey rish seaghyn, pian as baase
English: You are rid of sorrow, pain and death

Manx: Dy bragh cur moylley son y ghrayse
English: Forever giving praise for the grace

Manx: Ta stowit ort liorish Jee
English: That is bestowed upon you by God

Manx: Ny caarjyn deyr t’ou er n’aagail
English: The dear friends you have left

Manx: Ayns foddeeaght yn traa baarail
English: In longing, spending the time

Manx: Gys veeitys ad oo reesht
English: Until they meet you again

Manx: Cre’n veeiteil maynrey ass y noa
English: What happy meeting anew

Manx: Raad nagh vel baase agh beaynid bio
English: Where death is only eternnal living

Manx: Kionfenish Yeesey Chreest
English: In the presence of Jesus Christ

Manx: Ayns shen vees miolagh slane ec kione
English: There tempation will be completely ended

Manx: Son Jee nee chaglym thie E Chloan
English: For God will gather home His children

Manx: Dy ee jeh billey yn vea
English: To eat of the tree of life

Manx: Bee maynrys vooar oc erskyn glare
English: They will have great happiness beyond words

Manx: Sheese croymmey er ny straidyn airh
English: Bending down on the golden streets

Manx: Ec fakin Jee myr t’eh.
English: At seeing God as he is.
